verses.kjv: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.
verses.web: The revelation which Habakkuk the prophet saw.
verses.ct: This is the message that the prophet Habakkuk received from God.

verses.kjv: O LORD, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear! even cry out unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save!
verses.web: LORD, how long will I cry, and you will not hear? I cry out to you “Violence!” and will you not save?
verses.ct: "LORD, how long must I cry out for help before you listen? I keep shouting 'Violence!' but you don't step in to save us!

verses.kjv: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause me to behold grievance? for spoiling and violence are before me: and there are that raise up strife and contention.
verses.web: Why do you show me iniquity, and look at perversity? For destruction and violence are before me. There is strife, and contention rises up.
verses.ct: Why do you force me to witness so much wrongdoing? Why do you make me stare at all this suffering? Everywhere I look there's destruction and violence. Conflict and fighting are breaking out all around me.

verses.kjv: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.
verses.web: Therefore the law is paralyzed, and justice never prevails; for the wicked surround the righteous; therefore justice comes out perverted.
verses.ct: Because of this, the law has lost all its power, and justice never wins. The wicked have the righteous surrounded on every side, so every verdict that comes out is twisted and corrupt."

verses.kjv: Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for I will work a work in your days, which ye will not believe, though it be told you.
verses.web: “Look among the nations, watch, and wonder marvelously; for I am working a work in your days, which you will not believe though it is told you.
verses.ct: The LORD answered, "Look at the nations around you — watch closely, and be utterly amazed. I am doing something in your lifetime that you wouldn't believe even if someone told you about it.

verses.kjv: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the dwellingplaces that are not theirs.
verses.web: For, behold, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, that march through the width of the earth, to possess dwelling places that are not theirs.
verses.ct: I am raising up the Chaldeans — that ruthless, quick-striking nation. They will sweep across the whole earth, seizing lands and homes that don't belong to them.

verses.kjv: They are terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity shall proceed of themselves.
verses.web: They are feared and dreaded. Their judgment and their dignity proceed from themselves.
verses.ct: They are terrifying and fearsome. They answer to no one — they make their own laws and define their own greatness.

verses.kjv: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle that hasteth to eat.
verses.web: Their horses also are swifter than leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves. Their horsemen press proudly on. Yes, their horsemen come from afar. They fly as an eagle that hurries to devour.
verses.ct: Their horses are faster than leopards and fiercer than wolves hunting at dusk. Their cavalry charges forward with pride, riders pouring in from distant lands. They swoop down like an eagle diving for its prey.

verses.kjv: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up as the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.
verses.web: All of them come for violence. Their hordes face the desert. He gathers prisoners like sand.
verses.ct: Every one of them comes bent on violence. Their advancing hordes push forward like a scorching east wind, and they scoop up captives like handfuls of sand.

verses.kjv: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.
verses.web: Yes, he scoffs at kings, and princes are a derision to him. He laughs at every stronghold, for he builds up an earthen ramp, and takes it.
verses.ct: They mock kings and laugh at rulers. Every fortress is a joke to them — they simply pile up dirt ramps against the walls and capture it.

verses.kjv: Then shall his mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend, imputing this his power unto his god.
verses.web: Then he sweeps by like the wind, and goes on. He is indeed guilty, whose strength is his god.”
verses.ct: Then they sweep through like the wind and move on. But they are guilty, because they treat their own strength as their god."

verses.kjv: Art thou not from everlasting, O LORD my God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O LORD, thou hast ordained them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for correction.
verses.web: Aren’t you from everlasting, LORD my God, my Holy One? We will not die. LORD, you have appointed him for judgment. You, Rock, have established him to punish.
verses.ct: Habakkuk replied, "LORD my God, my Holy One — haven't you existed from eternity? Surely we won't be destroyed. LORD, you raised them up to carry out your judgment. O mighty God, you established them to discipline us.

verses.kjv: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?
verses.web: You who have purer eyes than to see evil, and who cannot look on perversity, why do you tolerate those who deal treacherously, and keep silent when the wicked swallows up the man who is more righteous than he,
verses.ct: Your eyes are too pure to approve of evil, and you cannot tolerate wrongdoing. So why do you put up with people who act treacherously? Why do you stay silent while the wicked devour those who are more righteous than they are?

verses.kjv: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?
verses.web: and make men like the fish of the sea, like the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?
verses.ct: You've let people become like fish in the sea, like creatures with no one to protect them.

verses.kjv: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.
verses.web: He takes up all of them with the hook. He catches them in his net, and gathers them in his dragnet. Therefore he rejoices and is glad.
verses.ct: The enemy hauls them all in with hooks, drags them away in nets, and scoops them up in fishing dragnets — then celebrates and throws a party over the catch.

verses.kjv: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion is fat, and their meat plenteous.
verses.web: Therefore he sacrifices to his net, and burns incense to his dragnet, because by them his life is luxurious, and his food is good.
verses.ct: That's why he worships his own net and burns incense to his dragnet — because those tools give him a life of luxury and the richest food.

verses.kjv: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?
verses.web: Will he therefore continually empty his net, and kill the nations without mercy?
verses.ct: Will he keep emptying his net and slaughtering nation after nation without mercy?"
